techmeme.title: How aligning with Trump's new administration lets Meta and X pivot from futile cooperation with the EU and other jurisdictions to confrontation and coercion (David Allen Green/Financial Times)
A survey finds that global banks could cut as many as 200K jobs in the next three to five years as AI encroaches on tasks currently carried out by human workers (William Shaw/Bloomberg)
A UK trial in the £1.5B class action suit against Apple is set to begin on Monday over allegations that the company levies "excessive and unfair" App Store fees (Financial Times)
US export controls may have slowed China's AI progress but they also spurred DeepSeek to innovate and release DeepSeek-V3, a top LLM, without the latest chips (Tyler Cowen/Bloomberg)
Malaysia's economy minister Rafizi Ramli says the country anticipates a surge in investment from Chinese tech companies as Beijing braces for more US tariffs (Owen Walker/Financial Times)
